@ xzxero
what could you reduce the overall file size too with handbrake?

Well, it really depends what settings you use, but a quick encode of the first episode shrunk(shrank?) it from 816mb to 243mb. I used cq22 and encoded the eng audio to 6ch aac @448kbps and left out the jap audio. I'm certain you can shrink it down even further if you feel the need.

As Cmryan said, if the files are to big for you, Re-encode them using Handbrake, But you will lose Quality on the video.

Setting appropriate for Monitor Size/Resolutioon

Monitors 24+/1080p leave it as it is.
monitors 22-23/1080  Leave it as  it is.
Monitors 19-21/720p resize to 720p using a  CRF of 20-23.

Monitors 15-18/ Guess these are SD monitors
You can use CRF of 24-26 for Mini Encodes which will look just as great on a SD monitor.

Moose, not sure how you're getting the mkv files to your ps3(transcoding or what), but you can try remuxing them without the japanese audio. Mp4/MKV tools works fine but I'm sure there are other ways as well.

Options for Streaming Videos to the ps3/Xbox

1. Download Ps3 Mediaserver, Allows the xbox and ps3 to play Mkv files.
2. Use Mp4Box and Mkvtollnix to remove Stream and Audio then remux using Mp4box.
3. Re-encode files using HAndbrake M4V which works on the xbox and ps3.
